comments.creator: frommozilla.comhash69@vano.org
comments.author: frommozilla.comhash69@vano.org
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

Open a webpage, click some links. Make sure back/forward buttons are not empty.
Then set system time for 2 hours back (or wait 2 hours).
Click some more links.
Press CTRL+SHIFT+DELETE to open "Clear Recent History" window
Select "Last hour" and  "Browsing and download history"
Press clear button


Actual results:

Back/Forward buttons are disabled (empty), even though they contained history from 2 hours back.


Expected results:

Session history should not be all wiped out it should obey the clearing rule selected by user.

comments.text:
session history just clears everything since it doesn't support clearing by a timeframe.
see http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/browser/base/content/sanitize.js#239

session history just clears everything since it doesn't support clearing by a timeframe.

comments.text: this is not related to bookmarks & history though, moving to general (maybe preferences?).
